name: Strand Palace Hotel

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Strand Palace Hotel on several occasions when visiting London. It has recently had a refurb and rooms are of an even better quality. It was exceptionally busy the weekend of our stay with 1000 breakfasts which meant a bit of queuing but hey no worries the breakfast is of exceptional standard just as we remember it. The location of the hotel is second to none. We walked everywhere as its so well signposted. The beds were very comfortable my only gripe is the pillows they are far too hard if you have a neck problem. It doesn't change anything though and we would definately return when we need an overnight stay in London again.
reviews.title: Happy return visit

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel, for a night out with colleagues, in the west end. We had 8 rooms. It took 20 minutes to check us in, then 3 of the keys did not work. The key issue took another 50 minutes to sort out. Most of the staff appear to be foriegn workers and not adequately trained. The rooms are very small but clean and ok. The TV in my room did not work. The que for breakfast took 20 minutes at 9.30 in the morning. Its as if the hotel was built for a lot less rooms, and that the original rooms, have all been divided to double or treble capacity. The hotel cannot cope with the number of guests. The reception, the breakfast room and lifts are all inadequate, and look like they were made for far less guests. Its ok, not expensive for London, but more like a huge Guest house than a Hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, Shame about the staff.

reviews.text: If you are looming for a great location especially for the theatre then this is ideal with easy walking to Covent garden. The hotel itself is very grand with doorman etc.
reviews.title: Great location but tiny rooms and too busy

reviews.text: However it seems to me that some of the rooms have been converted into two rooms. Our room was small with bed against the wall and no room to swing a cat. The additional rooms also causes there to be extra guests and we had to queue for 15 minutes to get into breakfast. The staff were rushed and we were unable to relax and plan the day. The same queuing applied to the lifts and even though we were on the sixth floor it was easier to take the stairs.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: Overall great location nice hotel but rooms poor and too many people.
reviews.title: Perfect city hotel

reviews.text: Although we normally stay at the Radisson Pastoria or the Meridien Picadilly on our trips to London, we decided to try out the Strand Palace on this trip. The location, as many have said, is exceptional, right on the Strand and within five minutes walk to Covent Gardens, Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square and the Charing Cross and Embankment tube stops. We paid 110 pounds a night, including breakfast and taxes, which, in comparison to other similar hotels in the area, was a steal for our 3 night stay.
reviews.title: Better than we expected, but could use some upgrading

reviews.text: The hotel is huge and the 700+ rooms are set out in beehive pattern on its 9 floors. We were on the 8th floor with an interior "courtyard" view. While clean, the hotel clearly needs updating, especially in the common areas which gave us the impression of being on a worn-out transatlantic ship of the 20s or 30s. (I was expecting the first seating "dinner is served" announcement at any moment.) The room was average size, but large compared to other accommodation in the area, and the bathroom was especially big and well-equipped with a very comfortable stand-in shower, although there were no amenities other than soap. Again, the room was spotless and the cleaning staff seemed to be roaming the halls at all hours.
reviews.title: A/C In Club Rooms

reviews.text: While the breakfast offerings were limited to the most typical English breakfast items (bacon, eggs, beans, sausage and stewed tomatoes), a few bread selections, yogurts and two juices, it was perfectly adequate and certainly more than your standard continental fare.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Given that the hotel seems to be popular and profitable, we think they could well afford a few upgrades that would bump it up from a slightly above-average hotel to a well above-average hotel. First and foremost, they should invest in installing air-conditioning. We did not need it in mid-November, but I can't imagine the same being true during the Summer. A large number of rooms are interior and the small courtyards simply do not offer much ventilation and it must be extremely hot and stuffy. Second, the television channel selection needs to be expanded. Currently, they offer a few BBC channels, Sky, a channel from Spain, one from Italy and one from Germany. We were traveling on pleasure, but stayed in on two nights as we were too tired on one night and not feeling well on the other. There was nothing to watch on the very limited channel selection. Further, anyone traveling on business would certainly want at least CNN or CNBC. It had been ages since I'd been to a hotel that did not offer at least CNN. Communication with hotel staff certainly needs some help. While the concierge was readily able to offer help, the operator refused to connect me with an ATT operator (and instead gave me a number which required me to dial for an outside line and therefore, be charged). On the night before we left, we called for a wake-up call for the following morning and actually woke up the operator. The wake up call never came on the following morning and as such, we missed a mass we'd planned to attend at Westminster Abbey. Finally, the common areas certainly need some touching up, especially the dark-ish lobby and the Titanic-like hallways.
reviews.title: Great location, adequate hotel
Loved it!!!
reviews.text: We would stay at the Strand Palace again with no hesitation, but it does need some help.

I booked a single room for four days through a promotion with British Air. Tremendous location and a very nice room (and I've stayed in a couple of London boutique hotels for three times the price). Was there during the June "Heat Wave" and, despite the lack of A/C, I just opened the window and it was great (wet towels???? - that's just silly)! That was also the weekend England had a win in the World Cup, so it was wild outside - yobs with painted bodies running around, chanting. I felt safe and secure inside the hotel; the staff was lovely - particularly Dexton in the Brasserie (excellent post- and pre-theater menu) and Denton, the concierge. My bathroom was absolutely spotless and super nice; the bartenders in the Mask Bar were wonderfully helpful and extremely efficient! I got the continental breakfast, not the full English one, and enjoyed that very much, too. I figure those of you who are unhappy, perhaps should just walk across the street to the Savoy and then pay for it!
reviews.title: Strand Palace is JUST FINE!!

likes.liked: — Staff and bath - room was fine

reviews.title: Comfy beds
reviews.text: Stayed four nights in a single club room. Hotel rather run down, room really small, club room closed for renovations, never got my promised club room robe; however, the room was worth it for the bed alone, one of the most comfortable I've slept in (once I asked for a couple extra pillows). Room was spotless, shower pressure great, didn't have the heat problems mentioned below, actually needed the comforter. Had one meal at the Carvery, bare bones decoration, but the food was good. Staff was friendly enough when I dealt with them (other than promising me my robe every day and not delivering it). Location outstanding. Wouldn't stay there if you want fancy, but for great location, good water pressure, comfy bed, and clean rooms, then I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Too Damn Hot!
reviews.text: You simply cannot beat the position of this hotel slap bang in the middle of London, right opposite the Savoy. If you want to be close to Covent Garden, Soho, Leicester Square or Trafalgar Square then this is the hotel for you.
Our club room was on the small side (but then most London hotel rooms are) but clean and well furnished.
reviews.title: Oh dear!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the temperature in the hotel was ridiculous. Although the heatwave had long passed by our trip, the hotel was stiffling. I normally feel the cold but I spent the night on top of the sheets sweating for Britain. As a consequence I had a very uncomfortable night and felt exhausted the next day. I might stay again, but only if it was minus 10 outside!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed at in London!

reviews.text: I must admit to being surprised by the poor reviews received by this hotel on this web-site. Myself and 3 friends stayed in 2 twin rooms at the end of August this year and enjoyed a thoroughly pleasant stay. Yes - there was some inevitable traffic noise, the decor is slightly 1950's London and the shower almost killed you but these are minor quibbles in a hotel which offered a great location, large rooms (inter-connecting in our case), friendly staff and an ample breakfast.
reviews.title: Great stay in the Strand Palace

reviews.text: Would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in London who is not too worried about perfection or maybe a relaxing weekend away.
reviews.title: Not too impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel easy enough. It's location is easy to find what with it being on a main street and served by many close by tube stations and bus stops. The entrance to the hotel was also easy to find.
reviews.title: Only plus point is location!

reviews.text: It had a large entrance that was well marked.
reviews.title: A OK hotel in a great location in central London

reviews.text: I walked inside and the reception area looked rather nice. There was marble everywhere. The reception desk was pretty easy to find and after only a couple of minutes I was checked in. The only issue that I had with checking in was that the receptionist seemed a little rude and sarcastic when I asked where the lifts were.
reviews.title: The Chook Cooker

reviews.text: Just got back from a stay at the strand. Paid 50 pounds per night (VAT and breakfast included) for a single room. Booked on the hotel's own web site. Had a great view on the 6th floor. Room was a good size and had a nice large bathroom. Always left the window open so it never got too hot. The breakfast was okay as long as I made it there by 8am. I once went at 9:30 and there wasn't really anything left. Location is wonderful. I loved the area. It was close to shops, theaters, and an internet cafe. I walked to Covent Garden Market (right around corner), British Museum (15 min), National Gallery (5 min), Westminster abbey (20 min), Buckingham Palace (20 min). For other thinigs I used the tube. Picadilly, Bakerloo, and Northern lines are within 5 min walking distance. The only one problem I had was with a person at the reception desk who could not explain something to me and started her answer with "I don't mean to be rude, but..." Besides that incident, the rest of the staff were very nice. Room was cleaned well. Staff at breakfast, rest of reception, and concierge were great. If I get a similar rate, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Deal & Great Location
good location and that's about it
reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 night stay. It's an old place with no air conditioning. We didn't know we could request fans. We saw this worker walking away with one and asked and he just sort of ran into the elevator and played dumb. Maybe they don't have enough for everyone or something. Our room faced Strand Ave. It was really noisy, so bring earplugs. The room wasn't much to brag about--it was livable. It's in a great location. There were 5 of us so it was more economical to cab it everywhere rather than taking the tube. The most we paid was 9 pounds to Madame Tussaud's Museum. Breakfast was adequate. The concierge staff was very helpful. I'd stay here again only if I get a really really cheap rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, excellent service, love coming back to this hotel.& now free WiFi in all rooms. its the staff that make this hotel great so looking to stay in London this is the hotel. rooms vary in size so the more you pay the bigger the room. our room was a good size and well kept. breakfast very busy you may have to queue but its worth the wait.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I used to stay at this hotel for a couple of times over the years. I can say that the main issue are rooms - many of them being old. In those rooms the feel is rather creepy. On the contrary, in the refurbished wings, the rooms are of much better quality and nicer, contemporary feel.
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable price, not good service

reviews.text: The hotel staff can be of not sufficient service level. Hotel is crowded with guests, so approaching reception desk can be longer, especially in the mornings.
reviews.title: Location and Atmosphere with a Reasonable Price!

reviews.text: Breakfast area is relatively small, you don't have enough privacy while dining as the tables are small and packed to accommodate as many guests.
reviews.title: nice hotel, central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hygiene can be problematic. Pests are no strangers to this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location
Great Location
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 5 nights here in January.

I could not think of a better location, it seemed like we were a 15 minute walk or a short ride on the underground from most of the major attractions: Buckingham Palace, British Museum, Parliament, Westminster Cathedral, St. James, etc.
reviews.title: Perfect location, good hotel
Disappointing and despressing
reviews.text: It is also in the heart of the theatre district.

I have just booked another stay at the Stand Palace. I have stayed here several times on American Airlines packages as well as booking on my own. Although it cannot be compared on an even par with American hotels (LARGE rooms), compared to other London hotels, this is certainly a bargain (if you book with online booking agents). The hotel's online booking does NOT give the best available rate out there. Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, many of them have NO view or a view of the inner "courtyard/empty space". Yes, like most European hotels, the lack of a/c can be stifling. BUT, you can get larger, air conditioned rooms with panoramic views at about 5-6 times the cost at the "famous" hotels. Just be ready to deal with outrageous charges for EVERYTHING they offer and, perhaps, a much less favorable location. I go to London regularly for the theatre. If you want a location that is convenient to MANY tourist atrractions, the theatres, the tube, shopping, then understand you may not be at the Savoy (across the street). But you'll be able to see a play, have a meal, take a tour, and go shopping on what you'll be saving in room rate. It's not perfect, but for what I want to pay for a place to sleep, it's close!
reviews.title: Great value and location

likes.disliked: — Heat - no a/c in summer and sometimes overwhelming in winter - open the windows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband have just returned from a stay for one night at the Strand Palace hotel. The hotel was very easy to find and the location is perfect for exploring central London. We only had a day, so it made it possible to walk around without having to use any transport.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: The staff seemed very friendly, although we really didn't have a lot to do with them. The room, although small, was modern and very clean. The room was near the back of the hotel, so traffic noise was at a minimum.
reviews.title: Avoid the Strand.

reviews.text: There were a few bars and restaurants at the hotel, with typical 'London' prices. We only ate in there for breakfast which was included in our price [£120.00] a full English, which was a buffet style and it was really nice.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel/ Prime Location

reviews.text: I would definately recommend staying there and would stay again. It has an easy atmosphere and had obviously been remodernised to what some reviews had said previously.
reviews.title: The location is the only thing it has going for it!
I beg you!!! Do not stay at the Strand Palace!! Read on...
reviews.text: I realize that London is a difficult place to find a decent hotel without breaking the bank..but come on...MANAGEMENT OF THE STRAND!!! PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING!!

reviews.title: Very Nice but here are some tips
reviews.text: first...hotels-- misrepresented the Strand ..or..the Strand misrepresented itself to hotels--. the internet site i booked on listed double rooms with dialup Internet as an amenity. ok. good, fine, I was ready to pay fo this as long as I had the comfort of logging on from my room. Guess what? My double did not have it. That should have been a 'club' double. Despite my complaint to the hotel manager on staff..(Barbara) she did not offer a free upgrade to the room that had been represented to me.

ok, so I buy Internet access for 12pounds for 24 hours to use in the lobby. then internet connectivity in the hotel was down!! of course, I find this out after they sold me the card. I insisted on a refund and she said yes to that. (I write this while still in the hotel from a local internet cafe) We'll see if it is off my bill when I check out tomorrow. the manager basically admited that they were having trouble with their internet provider. My guess is that the Strand failed to pay them.
reviews.title: One-night nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff is basically clueless and useless. they seem stacked to the rafters with trainees who just smile like idiots at you when you ask a question. on top of it all, the hotel itself is run down and dumpy. Chipped wood on the doors, old carpet, a general feeling of an old musty hotel. it seems to cater to a lot of Eastern European and Russian tourists. Yet, it promotes itself as a busines hotel as well!?!? Yeah, with no internet connection!
reviews.title: Hot and Old!

likes.disliked: — Room is old, plus there is no air conditioning.

reviews.text: can you tell this place stinks? I beg you...for location...go down the street to the Thistle for comparable price and location. They can't be any worse than the Strand Palace. Better yet, get a B&B or a 1star in Earls Court area. They are better that this place. IF THE OWNERS OF THE STRAND READ THIS,PLEASE...EITHER RENOVATE OR CLOSE.
reviews.title: Too Hot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and wife took a recent trip to London to see some shows. I can highly recommend the Srand Palace Hotel as a superb place to stay. The staff were extremely polite and helpful, the accommodation was top class, being very clean and tidy and the food was second to none. Nothing was too much trouble and it became very easy to relax during our stay. The prices of the drinks were also reasonable for this part of London.
reviews.title: Very well looked after

reviews.text: I go to London often on a off day to see some friends. We ended up being in The strand and the very first thing I noticed was the doorman or security guy (in Black suit) was swearing with his colleague. He did not seem to be happy. All I could hear was f***. As we got in the lounge bar din't seem to be big but was packed with people. Got a private snug area which was nice but not comfortable at all. Got on the bar to buy few drinks but it seemed like the server (old chap) was least interested to serve. On serving he was not happy and when I passed my card for the payment he was rude. Another lady along side who seemed to be a supervisor (blond hair and with a coat) noticed it but did not made an attempt to apologize or feel sorry for.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Later to avoid the place as it was too laid back we moved to the mask bar in the same building. Nice atmosphere, nothing more. But would definitely try the Indian restaurant on my next visit.
reviews.title: Great location!
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: Have stayed on many occasions due to work, in terms of location it's fantastic.
Few minutes walk from Covent Garden or Charing Cross underground stations.
reviews.title: Another great stay
Upgrade if necessary
reviews.text: We had a shock when we were shown the room (Club Twin) - so small that two people could hardly stand in it (one chair), windows could not be opened yet there was no ventilation. Luckily an executive room was available - it was like day and night and definitely worth the extra 50 pounds per night. There is a separate dining room for this price which means you do not have to queue for breakfast (one morning there must have been 80 people waiting). This is a very busy place, on Saturday night the lobby felt like a railway station. Nice bar if you can get a seat, prices for drinks very reasonable and good choice. Good breakfast too. Staff very efficient. Mattresses very hard, pillows terrible. Bathroom ok but lacks space for hanging towels and toiletries. Situation good for Covent Garden and theatres, less good for underground trains.

I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions. I have never been disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and adequate and the breakfast buffet is quite sufficient. The bar is a bit dull, but then again - why use the hotel's bar when the hotel is situated brilliantly near Covent Garden and Soho. Close to all the action. Lots of nice dining- and shopping opportunities nearby. A few times I have experienced a long queue of guests waiting to be seated for breakfast. Overall I recommend this hotel for it's staff and it's location. If you don't consider the location you may find the rates OK. If you do consider the location, the rates are actually close to being a bargain.
reviews.title: Good value and excelent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely clean hotel, excellent friendly and helpful staff. Our room had everything we needed, plenty of space, clean spacious bathroom, powerful shower. The toiletries provided were lovely and when I needed an emergency sewing kit reception had one sent up to me.
reviews.title: Surprise Theatre break weekend

reviews.text: Didn't want to go home!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Strand for my birthday in April. I had stayed at this hotel 5 years ago and it was ok. The hotel has undergone a reservation so all the rooms are neat & smart. The room I stayed in had wooden shutters on the window which blocked all the light in the mornings so great for a lie in. I was in 604 which had a comfy king bed & adequate storage space/work sitting area. The breakfast was good plenty of choice & the staff friendly. The doormen were very helpful & knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Awful Hotel

description: In the heart of the West End the Strand Palace Hotel is easily accessible from the City and Docklands areas. The property is located in close proximity to Covent Garden, Charing Cross and a short stroll from Waterloo station. Surrounded by some of London’s finest architectural and cultural landmarks, the hotel is the perfect base for leisure travelers, while for business it provides an impressive location for important meetings with well-equipped Conference and Events rooms.
